_header: An archbishop beyond the sea / was woning in a faire city
Title(s): Northern Homily Cycle ; Archbishop and the Nun
_description: The Archbishop and the Nun, in the Northern Homily Cycle — in couplets

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
Of on byschop þat a holy man wasAnd ȝett hym be tyd a
                    wonder case…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…And sayfe vs all owt of our synAnd bryng vs to þat ioy
                    þat neuer sall blyn

BodAsh42.First Lines:
The ersbisschope beȝonde þe seWas wonande in a faire
                    cite…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…And forto come to þat ilk blisseþare nowe þis
                    bisschope wiþ him is
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
AN Erchebisschop bi ȝonde þe seeWas wonynge in a riche
                    Citee…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And come wiþ him in to þat blisÞer nou
                    þis Bisschop wiþ him is. AMEN.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Die Evangelien-Geschichten der Homiliensammlung des Ms. Vernon.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         57 (1877): 241-316: 248-52.

CULAdd8335.First Lines:
Of a bischope þat holi man wasand ȝit hym tid a wondre
                    cas…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:
…And rayse vs alle oute of oure synneAnd brynge vs til þe
                    blisse þat neuer sale blynne

CULDd11.First Lines:
An Erchebischop beȝond þe sewas wonyng in a riche
                    cyte…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…& come wiþ him in to þat blisþer now
                    þis bischop wiþ him is

CULGg531.First Lines:
…And of þat ioy he had tyntTo sla hym selfe he had
                    ment…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
…And for to bryng vs to þat blysþere euer es yoie
                    with outen mysse
CULGg531.Note: Lines 1-204 missing due to loss of ff. 28-29.

BLAdd38010.First Lines:
An archebishop in a rich cyteWas wonnant by yonde þe
                    see…
BLAdd38010.Last Lines:
…And come to hym vnto þt blyseWhare now þis bisshop
                    with hym es

BLHar2391.First Lines: An archbichop be ȝond te sewas wonande in a fer cyte…
BLHar2391.Last Lines: …And for to comme to þat ilk blysþar now es bichop in es
BLHar2391.Attributed Title: Dominica infra octaua natalis domini (left margin, f. 160) plus “A tale” written above this

EDCPCM.First Lines:
…Sa stuelic[?] again him wasÞe fend þat him feld in
                    place…
EDCPCM.Last Lines:
…And cum wit him to þat blisseÞar nou þis
                    bischop wit him isse
EDCPCM.Note: Begins imperfectly at line 145 due to loss of folio(s).

Small,  John,
                        ed.

Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

MinULZ822.First Lines:
…þat he sulde one a hi fest daysyng þam a messe
                    fast pray þaiþe byschope sone hym vmbethoghtþat syng a
                    messe myght he noȝthor he ware schryvene of þat
                    syne…
MinULZ822.Last Lines:
…þat bytter hys & [ ]& may a man [ ]when he
                    was [ ]
MinULZ822.Note:
Imperfect at beginning due to loss of folios at front of volume; at ends
                    of lines due to torn leaves.

HunHM129.First Lines:
A narsebyssehope be ȝon þe seWas wonnand in a ryche
                    cyte…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…And com to hym in to þat blisWhare now þis besschop
                    with hym is
